mergeResults.content: Historical practice: ritual sacrifice, demon summoning via captured prisoners—Valdemaran stories dismissed as myth hold truth. Officially banned in Karse for decades. Lisle attack evidence: red-robed figures (Karsite features despite Menmellith misdirection), organized prisoner-taking instead of killing (requires effort/risk), suggests possible revival of blood magic practices. Border implications: Lisle near three-nation border; enough interaction for Rance to recognize Karsite features.

Historical practice involving ritual sacrifice and demon summoning via captured prisoners; Valdemaran stories dismissed as myth hold truth. Officially banned decades ago, but Sun-Priests suspected of reviving practices—cyclical returns during internal instability. Live captives needed for fresh sacrifice (more power than corpses). Lisle attack evidence: red-robed figures with Karsite features despite Menmellith misdirection; organized prisoner-taking (young and elderly included) instead of killing; special forces with military-grade weapons; requires effort/risk, represents fundamental policy shift if confirmed. Attacking across Valdemar border—unknown if other nations targeted. Border context: Lisle near three-nation junction; enough interaction for locals to recognize Karsite features.
